clinical_study.brief_title: SPICS-BIPOLAR for Long Term Follow up
clinical_study.official_title: SPICS (Secure Platform for Integrating Clinical Studies) for Recurrent (Bipolar) Affective Disorders for Long Term Follow up Treatment Regiments and Outcome in a Natural Setting

oversight_info.authority: Austria: Federal Ministry for Health and Women

brief_summary.textblock: monitoring system and data base for long term follow up of various treatment strategies in a naturalistic setting of recurrent affective disorders (unipolar, bipolar) open study design, prospective & retrospective

detailed_description.textblock: all hospitalized patients of a defined mixed urban and more rural area were consecutively interviewed at admission and entered into the data base. at discharge they gave written informed consent for further tracking and interviews.

primary_outcome.measure: natural course of recurrent affective disorders is monitored: number of participants with adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
primary_outcome.time_frame: patients from the cohort are contacted once a year (1 to 6 years)

study_pop.textblock: community of wiener neustadt and neunkirchen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- bipolar
Exclusion Criteria:
- all other diagnoses
